alert.note: Alert for Hanover (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:57AM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... South Anna River near Ashland affecting Hanover County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...South Anna River near Ashland. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to flood lowlands downstream of gage in the vicinity of VA routes 686 and 667. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM EST Wednesday was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to fall through this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tonight. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 06/25/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM EST.
